title: Keto Garlic-Butter Salmon & Asparagus
description: Pan-seared salmon fillets finished with a lemon-garlic butter sauce served alongside roasted asparagus. Bright citrus, rich butter, and garlicky herbs make this a quick low-carb weeknight dinner with restaurant-style results.

ingredients.notes: about 4 fillets, ~170 g (6 oz) each; patted dry
4 tbsp divided (do not use salted unless adjusting salt)
optional sprinkle over asparagus for extra flavor
optional, for a touch of heat

steps.text: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Toss trimmed asparagus with half the olive oil, half the salt, and half the pepper on a rimmed baking sheet; spread in a single layer.
Roast asparagus in the preheated oven until tender-crisp and slightly blistered, turning once halfway through.
While asparagus roasts, pat salmon fillets dry, season flesh side with remaining salt and pepper, and lightly rub with a small amount of olive oil.
Heat a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat until hot; add 1 tbsp olive oil. Place salmon fillets skin-side down and sear without moving until skin is crisp and golden.

Flip fillets and add 2 tbsp butter to the pan; baste the tops with melted butter for a minute or two until salmon reaches desired doneness (medium-rare to medium). Remove salmon to a warm plate and tent loosely with foil.
Reduce heat to medium-low and add remaining butter to the skillet. Add minced garlic and cook briefly until fragrant, stirring, without browning the garlic.
Stir in lemon juice, lemon zest, and red pepper flakes (if using). Scrape browned bits from the pan and simmer the garlic-butter sauce gently for about 30 seconds to meld flavors.
Return salmon to the pan for a few seconds in the sauce to warm through and spoon sauce over the fillets. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Divide roasted asparagus among plates, place salmon on top or alongside, spoon extra garlic-butter sauce over everything, sprinkle with chopped parsley and optional parmesan, and serve immediately.
